channel.title: The Family of Edward H. Mills of Brooktondale New York on M. E. Mills
channel.description: Recent content in The Family of Edward H. Mills of Brooktondale New York on M. E. Mills

item.title: Edward H. Mills
item.description: Edward Hallock Mills, born 25 Mar 1819, Smithtown, NY, died 01 Jan 1908, Brookton, NY. Patriarch of the Mills family. Co-owner, general stores E. H. Mills & Co. in Cofu NY and owner E. H. Mills in Motts Corners/Brookton NY.

item.title: Mary Ann Mills
item.description: Mary Ann (Pine) Mills, born 08 Feb 1819, Hempstead NY, died 28 Dec 1895, Brookton NY. Matriarch of the Mills family, first wife of Edward Hallock Mills, married 29 Dec 1850, Hempstead, NY.

item.title: Jonas E. Mills
item.description: Jonas E. Mills, born 1852, Staten Island, NY, died 14 October 1885, Brookton NY. Oldest child of Edward H. and Mary Ann Mills.

item.title: Horace F. Mills
item.description: Horace F. Mills, born 1854, Staten Island, NY, died 27 October 1876, Corfu NY. Second child of Edward H. and Mary Ann Mills.

item.title: Emily Mills
item.description: Mary Emily Mills, born Dec 1858 Staten Island, NY, died 03 Nov 1937 Brooktondale NY, who went by Emily, was the youngest child of Edward H. and Mary Ann Mills. Proprietor of M. E. Mills general store in Brookton/Brooktondale NY. Active in the temperance movement in the Independent Order of Good Templars and the Women’s Christian Temperance Union, as well as Sunday School teacher and piano player in Brooktonale Congregational Church. She was highly regarded as a cheerful, kind, and charitable person.

item.title: Hannah Mills
item.description: Hannah (Thatcher) Eastman Mills, born 21 May 1824, England, died 25 Feb 1917, Brookton, NY. Second wife of Edward H. Mills, married 30 Dec 1896 and step-mother to Emily. Active member of Brookton Congregational Church, Ladies Aid Society and Women’s Christian Temperance Union.

item.title: Ellen Gould
item.description: Ellen Jane (Andrews) Predmore Gould, born 27 Mar 1848, died 31 Oct 1929. Ellen lived in the Mills Home, possibly for over a decade, to help care for Hannah and to help Emily with the home and store. She was a devoted member of Brookton Baptist Church and active in the temperance movement.
